instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A 680ma no display
threads.message:
Hi Macbook  came in No spillage with short on PP3V3_S5 after removing and replacing u7800 short is gone. The board draws up to 680ma then drops to 340ma. Chipmunk usb activity led shows activity on usb. but black screen. (also tried known good screen)
L8030 1.2V
L7960 .95V
L7900 1V
L8060 1V
L7370 .85V
L7220 .55V
L7210 .55V
L7430/20/10    0V    2ohm resistance.
L7330 1.05V
L7030 13V
L8410 0V
L7690 3.3V
L7670 5V.

What signal area would I check now?

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A 680ma no display
threads.message:
Did you test external video?
How did the problem appear?

Check diode mode to ground on EDP_INT_ lines of J8500.

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A 680ma no display
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 101663, member: 682"]
Did you test external video?
How did the problem appear?

Check diode mode to ground on EDP_INT_ lines of J8500.
[/QUOTE]
Hi yes I meant to mention no external video apologies. All diode reading are good.
When I got it, I fixed the initial issue which was u7800 then upon testing found where I am at now.

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A 680ma no display
threads.message: Just in case, try known good, clean ME BIOS.
